description: It is assumed that every person with a different unique identifier is in fact a different person and should be treated independently.
comment: Primary Key for the PERSON table

description: This field is meant to capture the biological sex at birth of the Person. This field should not be used to study gender identity issues.

comment: Year extracted from the person's date of birth
Month extracted from the person's date of birth
Day extracted from the person's date of birth

description: This field is not required but highly encouraged.
comment: Precise datetime of birth when available

description: This field captures race or ethnic background of the person.
This field captures Ethnicity as defined by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) of the US Government.
The location refers to the physical address of the person.
The Provider refers to the last known primary care provider (General Practitioner).
The Care Site refers to where the Provider typically provides the primary care.
Use this field to link back to persons in the source data.
comment: Value from source data for reference

description: This field is used to store the biological sex of the person from the source data.
comment: Value from source data for reference

description: Due to the small number of options, this tends to be zero.
This field is used to store the race of the person from the source data.
comment: Value from source data for reference

description: Due to the small number of options, this tends to be zero.
This field is used to store the ethnicity of the person from the source data.
comment: Value from source data for reference

description: Due to the small number of options, this tends to be zero.
